newsitem.title: JAPAN: IBJ denies report on plan to sell Softbank shares.
newsitem.headline: IBJ denies report on plan to sell Softbank shares.

text.p: The Industrial Bank of Japan Ltd (IBJ) on Monday denied a newspaper report at the weekend that said it would sell all its shares in Softbank Corp.
"We have not sold all the shares we hold in Softbank and we have not decided to sell all the Softbank shares we hold, either," an IBJ spokesman told Reuters.
"So we have not told Softbank that we would sell its shares as reported," he said.

Japanese economic daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said on Saturday that the IBJ would sell all its shares in Softbank by next March 31. It said IBJ, Softbank's fifth-largest shareholder with a 0.9 percent stake as of March 31 this year, had already sold some of the shares. The paper said IBJ had notified Softbank of its planned share sale.
